nodes.text: What about the point that, with Brexit looming, what that may bring, being in the middle of a pandemic
Fiona Bruce : What about the point that, with Brexit looming, what that may bring, being in the middle of a pandemic, this is something that should be put on the back burner for now
Pure Questioning
Kate Forbes' thought about the point that, with Brexit looming, what that may bring is something that should be put on the back burner for now, being in the middle of a pandemic is xxx
Hyewon: Fiona Bruce : What about the point that, with Brexit looming, what that may bring, being in the middle of a pandemic, this is something that should be put on the back burner for now
Kate Forbes : That’s why right now from the Scottish government perspective of my day is spent in dealing with the virus and dealing with the economic fall-out of the virus
Asserting
right now from the Scottish government's perspective, Kate Forbes' day is spent in dealing with the virus and dealing with the economic fall-out of the virus
Hyewon: Kate Forbes : That’s why right now from the Scottish government perspective of my day is spent in dealing with the virus and dealing with the economic fall-out of the virus
Kate Forbes : there are going to be questions emerging
Asserting
there are going to be questions emerging
Hyewon: Kate Forbes : there are going to be questions emerging
Kate Forbes : If you take one question like economic recovery, the last time we saw the UK government borrowing to these levels was probably 2008 in the aftermath of the financial crash
Asserting
if you take one question like economic recovery, the last time we saw the UK government borrowing to these levels was probably 2008 in the aftermath of the financial crash
Hyewon: Kate Forbes : If you take one question like economic recovery, the last time we saw the UK government borrowing to these levels was probably 2008 in the aftermath of the financial crash
Kate Forbes : That was followed by a decade of austerity, where the poorest in society paid for the failures
Asserting
the UK government borrowing in 2008 was followed by a decade of austerity, where the poorest in society paid for the failures
Hyewon: Kate Forbes : That was followed by a decade of austerity, where the poorest in society paid for the failures
Kate Forbes : As we come out of this crisis, I want to ensure that we are investing in people, we are investing in infrastructure and we deal with our public finances in a fundamentally different way
Asserting
as we come out of this crisis, Kate Forbes wants to ensure that we are investing in people, we are investing in infrastructure and we deal with our public finances in a fundamentally different way

Hyewon: Kate Forbes : As we come out of this crisis, I want to ensure that we are investing in people, we are investing in infrastructure and we deal with our public finances in a fundamentally different way
Kate Forbes : That will require financial powers, fiscal powers to be in the hands of Scottish government not the Conservatives in Westminster that most people in Scotland can vote for
Asserting

ensuring investment in people and infrastructure and dealing with our public finances in a fundamentally different way will require financial powers, fiscal powers to be in the hands of Scottish government, not the Conservatives in Westminster that most people in Scotland cannot vote for
Hyewon: Kate Forbes : That will require financial powers, fiscal powers to be in the hands of Scottish government not the Conservatives in Westminster that most people in Scotland can vote for
